intro: Sclerochiton obtusisepalus, commonly known as the blunt-sepal sclerochiton, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Malvaceae. It is native to tropical regions of Africa and is characterized by its woody stems and palmate leaves. The plant produces small, clustered flowers with five sepals that are notably broad and rounded. Its fruit is a capsule that splits open to release numerous small seeds. Sclerochiton obtusisepalus is often found in moist, shaded habitats and is of interest to botanists due to its unique morphological features.
